narrative.narrative: Lufthansa Cargo is the cargo division of Lufthansa and is based at Frankfurt Airport with secondary hubs at Hyderabad,India, Krasnoyarsk,Russia and Novosibirsk,Russia. It was founded in 1994. It has used 747-200F's and a few 737-300C's in the past. It's current fleet is 17 MD-11F's and 3 777F's and has 2 777F's on order as of February 2014. It serves 57 destinations around the world. If it wants they can also use the cargo hold of any Lufthansa Group plane if need be, which would include 300 passengers planes of such airlines as Austrian,Brussels, and SunExpress airlines. German Cargo was their previous incarnation that was also owned and operated by Lufthansa, and in fact Lufthansa Cargo was used as a brand by them even before the official founding of the seperate airline. German Cargo was around from 1977-1993, right before Lufthansa Cargo's founding, and some of the old cargo carriers assets were transferred to the new Lufthansa Cargo including some planes.
